kodkod.ast

Class Expression

  • java.lang.Object
    • kodkod.ast.Node
      • kodkod.ast.Expression
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinaryExpression, Comprehension, IfExpression, IntToExprCast, LeafExpression, NaryExpression, ProjectExpression, UnaryExpression

    public abstract class Expression
extends Node
    A relational expression. Unless otherwise noted, all methods in this class throw a NullPointerException when given null arguments.
    Author:
    Emina Torlak
    Specfields:
    arity: int
    Invariants:
    arity > 0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Expression IDEN
      The identity relation: maps all atoms in a universe of discourse to themselves.
      static Expression INTS
      The integer relation: contains all atoms bound to integers
      static Expression NONE
      The empty relation: contains no atoms.
      static Expression UNIV
      The universal relation: contains all atoms in a universe of discourse.

      abstract <E,F,D,I> E accept(ReturnVisitor<E,F,D,I> visitor)
      Accepts the given visitor and returns the result.
      IntExpression apply(ExprCastOperator op)
      Returns the cast of this expression to an integer expression, that represents either the cardinality of this expression (if op is CARDINALITY) or the sum of the integer atoms it contains (if op is SUM).
      Expression apply(ExprOperator op)
      Returns the expression that results from applying the given unary operator to this.
      Formula apply(Multiplicity mult)
      Returns the formula that results from applying the specified multiplicity to this expression.

      Returns the composition of the given expressions using the given operator.

      • IDEN

        public static final Expression IDEN
        The identity relation: maps all atoms in a universe of discourse to themselves.

      • INTS

        public static final Expression INTS
        The integer relation: contains all atoms bound to integers

      • NONE

        public static final Expression NONE
        The empty relation: contains no atoms.

      • UNIV

        public static final Expression UNIV
        The universal relation: contains all atoms in a universe of discourse.

    • Method Detail

      • accept

        public abstract <E,F,D,I> E accept(ReturnVisitor<E,F,D,I> visitor)
        Accepts the given visitor and returns the result.
        Specified by:
        accept in class Node
        Returns:
        the result of being visited by the given visitor
        See Also:
        Node.accept(kodkod.ast.visitor.ReturnVisitor)

      • apply

        public final IntExpression apply(ExprCastOperator op)
        Returns the cast of this expression to an integer expression, that represents either the cardinality of this expression (if op is CARDINALITY) or the sum of the integer atoms it contains (if op is SUM).
        Returns:
        {e: IntExpression | e.op = op && e.expression = this}

      • apply

        public final Expression apply(ExprOperator op)
        Returns the expression that results from applying the given unary operator to this.
        Requires:
        op.unary()
        Returns:
        {e: Expression | e.expression = this && e.op = this }
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - this.arity != 2

      • apply

        public final Formula apply(Multiplicity mult)
        Returns the formula that results from applying the specified multiplicity to this expression. The SET multiplicity is not allowed.
        Returns:
        {f: Formula | f.multiplicity = mult && f.expression = this}
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - mult = SET

      • arity

        public abstract int arity()
        Returns the arity of this expression.
        Returns:
        this.arity

      • closure

        public final Expression closure()
        Returns the transitive closure of this. The effect of this method is the same as calling this.apply(CLOSURE).
        Returns:
        this.apply(CLOSURE)

      • compare

        public final Formula compare(ExprCompOperator op,
              Expression expr)
        Returns the formula that represents the comparison of this and the given expression using the given comparison operator.
        Returns:
        {f: Formula | f.left = this && f.right = expr && f.op = op}

      • compose

        public static Expression compose(ExprOperator op,
                 Collection<? extends Expression> exprs)
        Returns the composition of the given expressions using the given operator.
        Requires:
        exprs.size() = 2 => op.binary(), exprs.size() > 2 => op.nary()
        Returns:
        exprs.size()=1 => exprs.iterator().next() else {e: Expression | e.children = exprs.toArray() and e.op = this }

      • compose

        public static Expression compose(ExprOperator op,
                 Expression... exprs)
        Returns the composition of the given expressions using the given operator.
        Requires:
        exprs.length = 2 => op.binary(), exprs.length > 2 => op.nary()
        Returns:
        exprs.length=1 => exprs[0] else {e: Expression | e.children = exprs and e.op = this }

      • compose

        public final Expression compose(ExprOperator op,
                 Expression expr)
        Returns the composition of this and the specified expression, using the given binary operator.
        Requires:
        op in ExprOperator.BINARY
        Returns:
        {e: Expression | e.left = this and e.right = expr and e.op = this }

      • count

        public final IntExpression count()
        Returns the cardinality of this expression. The effect of this method is the same as calling this.apply(CARDINALITY).
        Returns:
        this.apply(CARDINALITY)

      • difference

        public final Expression difference(Expression expr)
        Returns the difference of this and the specified expression. The effect of this method is the same as calling this.compose(DIFFERENCE, expr).
        Returns:
        this.compose(DIFFERENCE, expr)

      • eq

        public final Formula eq(Expression expr)
        Returns the formula 'this = expr'. The effect of this method is the same as calling this.compare(EQUALS, expr).
        Returns:
        this.compare(EQUALS, expr)

      • in

        public final Formula in(Expression expr)
        Returns the formula 'this in expr'. The effect of this method is the same as calling this.compare(SUBSET, expr).
        Returns:
        this.compare(SUBSET, expr)

      • intersection

        public static Expression intersection(Collection<? extends Expression> exprs)
        Returns the intersection of the given expressions. The effect of this method is the same as calling compose(INTERSECTION, exprs).
        Returns:
        compose(INTERSECTION, exprs)

        public static Expression intersection(Expression... exprs)
        Returns the intersection of the given expressions. The effect of this method is the same as calling compose(INTERSECTION, exprs).
        Returns:
        compose(INTERSECTION, exprs)

        public final Expression intersection(Expression expr)
        Returns the intersection of this and the specified expression. The effect of this method is the same as calling this.compose(INTERSECTION, expr).
        Returns:
        this.compose(INTERSECTION, expr)

        public final Expression join(Expression expr)
        Returns the join of this and the specified expression. The effect of this method is the same as calling this.compose(JOIN, expr).
        Returns:
        this.compose(JOIN, expr)

        Returns:
        this.apply(LONE)

        public static Expression override(Collection<? extends Expression> exprs)
        Returns the override of the given expressions. The effect of this method is the same as calling compose(OVERRIDE, exprs).
        Returns:

        public static Expression override(Expression... exprs)
        Returns the override of the given expressions. The effect of this method is the same as calling compose(OVERRIDE, exprs).
        Returns:
        compose(OVERRIDE, exprs)

      • override

        public final Expression override(Expression expr)
        Returns the relational override of this with the specified expression. The effect of this method is the same as calling this.compose(OVERRIDE, expr).
        Returns:
        this.compose(OVERRIDE, expr)

      • product

        public static Expression product(Collection<? extends Expression> exprs)
        Returns the product of the given expressions. The effect of this method is the same as calling compose(PRODUCT, exprs).
        Returns:

        Returns the product of the given expressions. The effect of this method is the same as calling compose(PRODUCT, exprs).

      • product

        public final Expression product(Expression expr)
        Returns the product of this and the specified expression. The effect of this method is the same as calling this.compose(PRODUCT, expr).
        Returns:
        this.compose(PRODUCT, expr)

      • project

        public final Expression project(IntExpression... columns)
        Returns the projection of this expression onto the specified columns.
        Returns:
        {e: Expression | e = project(this, columns) }
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - columns.length < 1

      • reflexiveClosure

        public final Expression reflexiveClosure()
        Returns the reflexive transitive closure of this. The effect of this method is the same as calling this.apply(REFLEXIVE_CLOSURE).
        Returns:
        this.apply(REFLEXIVE_CLOSURE)

        public final Formula some()
        Returns the formula 'some this'. The effect of this method is the same as calling this.apply(SOME).
        Returns:
        this.apply(SOME)

      • sum

        public final IntExpression sum()
        Returns the sum of the integer atoms in this expression. The effect of this method is the same as calling this.apply(SUM).
        Returns:
        this.apply(SUM)

      • transpose

        public final Expression transpose()
        Returns the transpose of this. The effect of this method is the same as calling this.apply(TRANSPOSE).
        Returns:
        this.apply(TRANSPOSE)

        Returns the union of the given expressions. The effect of this method is the same as calling compose(UNION, exprs).
